   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(op_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   26:          bsl_bsr/1,logical/1,t_not/1,relop_simple/1,relop/1,
   27:          complex_relop/1,unsafe_fusing/1,
   28:          range_tests/1,combined_relops/1,typed_relop/1,
   29:          term_equivalence/1]).
   30: 
   31: -import(lists, [foldl/3,flatmap/2]).
   32: 
   33: suite() ->
   34:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   35:      {timetrap, {minutes, 5}}].
   36: 
   37: all() ->
   38:     [bsl_bsr, logical, t_not, relop_simple, relop,
   39:      complex_relop, unsafe_fusing, range_tests,
   40:      combined_relops, typed_relop, term_equivalence].
   41: 
   42: %% Test the bsl and bsr operators.
   43: bsl_bsr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   44:     RawValues = [-16#8000009-2,-1,0,1,2,73,16#8000000,bad,[]],
   45: 
   46:     [bsl_bsr_const(V) || V <- RawValues],
   47: 
   48:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- RawValues],
   49:     %% Try to use less memory by splitting the cases
   50: 
   51:     Cases1 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsl'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   52:     N1 = length(Cases1),
   53:     run_test_module(Cases1, false),
   54: 
   55:     Cases2 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsr'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   56:     N2 = length(Cases2),
   57:     run_test_module(Cases2, false),
   58: 
   59:     {comment,integer_to_list(N1 + N2) ++ " cases"}.
   60: 
   61: %% Tests constant-argument optimizations in `bsl`/`bsr`
   62: bsl_bsr_const(A) ->
   63:     BSL = id('bsl'),
   64:     BSR = id('bsr'),
   65: 
   66:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(1, A)), (catch 1 bsl A)),
   67:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(3, A)), (catch 3 bsl A)),
   68:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(7, A)), (catch 7 bsl A)),
   69: 
   70:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 1)), (catch A bsl 1)),
   71:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 3)), (catch A bsl 3)),
   72:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 7)), (catch A bsl 7)),
   73: 
   74:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsl A)),
   75:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsl A)),
   76:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsl A)),
   77: 
   78:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -2)), (catch A bsl -2)),
   79:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -4)), (catch A bsl -4)),
   80:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -8)), (catch A bsl -8)),
   81: 
   82:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(1, A)), (catch 1 bsr A)),
   83:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(3, A)), (catch 3 bsr A)),
   84:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(7, A)), (catch 7 bsr A)),
   85: 
   86:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 1)), (catch A bsr 1)),
   87:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 3)), (catch A bsr 3)),
   88:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 7)), (catch A bsr 7)),
   89: 
   90:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsr A)),
   91:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsr A)),
   92:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsr A)),
   93: 
   94:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -2)), (catch A bsr -2)),
   95:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -4)), (catch A bsr -4)),
   96:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -8)), (catch A bsr -8)),
   97: 
   98: 
   99:     %% These numbers can be shifted left one or zero times while remaining a
  100:     %% small on 32-bit platforms.
  101:     %%
  102:     %% The test relies on the compiler turning these into constants.
  103:     HighEdge32 = (1 bsl (32 - 6)) - 1,
  104:     LowEdge32 = -(1 bsl (32 - 6)),
  105: 
  106:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsl A)),
  107:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsl A)),
  108:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsr A)),
  109:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsr A)),
  110: 
  111:     HighEdge64 = (1 bsl (64 - 6)) - 1,
  112:     LowEdge64 = -(1 bsl (64 - 6)),
  113: 
  114:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsl A)),
  115:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsl A)),
  116:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsr A)),
  117:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsr A)),
  118: 
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: bsl_bsr_compare_results(Same, Same) ->
  122:     ok;
  123: bsl_bsr_compare_results({'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}, {'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}) ->
  124:     %% The applied and inlined implementations may differ in whether they include
  125:     %% the operator as the top element of the stack.
  126:     ok.
  127: 
  128: %% Test the logical operators and internal BIFs.
  129: logical(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     Vs0 = [true,false,bad],
  131:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  132:     Cases = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['and','or','xor'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
  133:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  134:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  135: 
  136: %% Test the not operator and internal BIFs.
  137: t_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     Cases = [{'not',unvalue(V)} || V <- [true,false,42,bad]],
  139:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  140:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  141: 
  142: %% Test that simlpe relations between relation operators hold.
  143: relop_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  144:     Big1 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  145:     Big2 = 38374938373887374983978484,
  146:     F1 = float(Big1),
  147:     F2 = float(Big2),
  148:     T1 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  149:     T2 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  150:     Terms = [-F2,Big2,-F1,-Big1,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,-0.0,42,42.0,Big1,F1,Big2,F2,
  151:              a,b,{T1,a},{T2,b},[T1,Big1],[T2,Big2]],
  152: 
  153:     Combos = [{V1,V2} || V1 <- Terms, V2 <- Terms],
  154: 
  155:     lists:foreach(fun({A,B}) -> relop_simple_do(A,B) end,
  156:                   Combos),
  157: 
  158:     repeat(fun() ->
  159:                    Size = rand:uniform(100),
  160:                    Rnd1 = make_rand_term(Size),
  161:                    {Rnd2,0} = clone_and_mutate(Rnd1, rand:uniform(Size)),
  162:                    relop_simple_do(Rnd1,Rnd2)
  163:            end,
  164:            1000),
  165:     ok.
  166: 
  167: relop_simple_do(V1,V2) ->
  168:     %%io:format("compare ~p\n   and  ~p\n",[V1,V2]),
  169: 
  170:     L = V1 < V2,
  171:     L = not (V1 >= V2),
  172:     L = V2 > V1,
  173:     L = not (V2 =< V1),
  174: 
  175:     G = V1 > V2,
  176:     G = not (V1 =< V2),
  177:     G = V2 < V1,
  178:     G = not (V2 >= V1),
  179: 
  180:     ID = V1 =:= V2,
  181:     ID = V2 =:= V1,
  182:     ID = not (V1 =/= V2),
  183:     ID = not (V2 =/= V1),
  184: 
  185:     implies(ID, V1 == V2),
  186: 
  187:     EQ = V1 == V2,
  188:     EQ = V2 == V1,
  189:     EQ = not (V1 /= V2),
  190:     EQ = not (V2 /= V1),
  191: 
  192:     case {L, EQ, ID, G, cmp_emu(V1,V2)} of
  193:         { true, false, false, false, -1} -> ok;
  194:         {false, true,  false, false,  0} -> ok;
  195:         {false, true,   true, false,  0} -> ok;
  196:         {false, false, false, true,  +1} -> ok
  197:     end.
  198: 
  199: implies(false, _) -> ok;
  200: implies(true, true) -> ok.
  201: 
  202: %% Emulate internal "cmp"
  203: cmp_emu(A,B) when is_tuple(A), is_tuple(B) ->
  204:     SA = size(A),
  205:     SB = size(B),
  206:     if SA =:= SB -> cmp_emu(tuple_to_list(A),tuple_to_list(B));
  207:        SA > SB -> +1;
  208:        SA < SB -> -1
  209:     end;
  210: cmp_emu([A|TA],[B|TB]) ->
  211:     case cmp_emu(A,B) of
  212:         0   -> cmp_emu(TA,TB);
  213:         CMP -> CMP
  214:     end;
  215: cmp_emu(A,B) ->
  216:     %% We cheat and use real "cmp" for the primitive types.
  217:     if A < B -> -1;
  218:        A > B -> +1;
  219:        true -> 0
  220:     end.					              
  221: 
  222: make_rand_term(1) ->
  223:     make_rand_term_single();
  224: make_rand_term(Arity) ->
  225:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  226:         1 ->
  227:             make_rand_list(Arity);
  228:         2 ->
  229:             list_to_tuple(make_rand_list(Arity));
  230:         3 ->
  231:             {Car,Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  232:             [Car|make_rand_term(Rest)]
  233:     end.
  234: 
  235: make_rand_term_single() ->
  236:     Range = 1 bsl rand:uniform(200),
  237:     case rand:uniform(12) of
  238:         1 -> random;
  239:         2 -> uniform;
  240:         3 -> rand:uniform(Range) - (Range div 2);
  241:         4 -> Range * (rand:uniform() - 0.5);
  242:         5 -> 0;
  243:         6 -> 0.0;
  244:         7 -> make_ref();
  245:         8 -> self();
  246:         9 -> term_to_binary(rand:uniform(Range));
  247:         10 -> fun(X) -> X*Range end; 
  248:         11 -> fun(X) -> X/Range end;
  249:         12 -> []
  250:     end.	    
  251: 
  252: make_rand_term_rand_size(1) ->
  253:     {make_rand_term(1), 0};
  254: make_rand_term_rand_size(MaxArity) ->
  255:     Arity = rand:uniform(MaxArity-1),
  256:     {make_rand_term(Arity), MaxArity-Arity}.
  257: 
  258: make_rand_list(0) -> [];
  259: make_rand_list(Arity) ->
  260:     {Term, Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  261:     [Term | make_rand_list(Rest)].
  262: 
  263: 
  264: clone_and_mutate(Term, 0) ->
  265:     {clone(Term), 0};
  266: clone_and_mutate(_Term, 1) ->
  267:     {Mutation, _} = make_rand_term_rand_size(10), % MUTATE!
  268:     {Mutation, 0};
  269: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) when is_tuple(Term) ->
  270:     {Clone,NewCnt} = clone_and_mutate(tuple_to_list(Term),Cnt),
  271:     {my_list_to_tuple(Clone), NewCnt};
  272: clone_and_mutate([Term|Tail], Cnt) ->
  273:     {Car,Cnt1} = clone_and_mutate(Term,Cnt),
  274:     {Cdr,Cnt2} = clone_and_mutate(Tail,Cnt1),
  275:     {[Car | Cdr], Cnt2};
  276: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) ->
  277:     {clone(Term), Cnt-1}.
  278: 
  279: clone(Term) ->
  280:     binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)).
  281: 
  282: my_list_to_tuple(List) ->
  283:     try list_to_tuple(List)
  284:     catch
  285:         error:badarg -> 
  286:             %%io:format("my_list_to_tuple got badarg exception.\n"),
  287:             list_to_tuple(purify_list(List))
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: purify_list(List) ->
  291:     lists:reverse(purify_list(List, [])).
  292: purify_list([], Acc) -> Acc;
  293: purify_list([H|T], Acc) -> purify_list(T, [H|Acc]);
  294: purify_list(Other, Acc) -> [Other|Acc].
  295: 
  296: 
  297: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on literals.
  298: relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  299:     Big1 = -38374938373887374983978484,
  300:     Big2 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  301:     F1 = float(Big1),
  302:     F2 = float(Big2),
  303:     Bin = <<"abc">>,
  304:     BitString = <<0:7>>,
  305:     Map = #{a => b},
  306:     EmptyMap = #{},
  307:     Vs0 = [a,b,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,-0,0,42,42.0,Big1,Big2,F1,F2,
  308:            Bin,BitString,Map,EmptyMap,[16#1234_5678_abcd]],
  309:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  310:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  311:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  312: 
  313: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on lists and tuples.
  314: complex_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  315:     Big = 99678557475484872464269855544643333,
  316:     Float = float(Big),
  317:     Bin = <<"abc">>,
  318:     BitString = <<0:7>>,
  319:     EmptyBitString = <<>>,
  320:     Map = #{a => b},
  321:     EmptyMap = #{},
  322:     Vs0 = [an_atom,42.0,42,0.0,-0.0,Big,Float,Bin,BitString,
  323:            EmptyBitString,Map,EmptyMap],
  324:     Vs = flatmap(fun(X) -> [unvalue({X}),unvalue([X])] end, Vs0),
  325:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  326:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  327: 
  328: binop(Ops, Vs) ->
  329:     Run = fun(Op, N) -> Cases = [{Op,V1,V2} || V1 <- Vs, V2 <- Vs],
  330:                         run_test_module(Cases, true),
  331:                         N + length(Cases) end,
  332:     NumCases = foldl(Run, 0, Ops),
  333:     {comment,integer_to_list(NumCases) ++ " cases"}.
  334: 
  335: run_test_module(Cases, GuardsOk) ->
  336:     Es = [expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  337:     Ok = unvalue(ok),
  338:     Gts = case GuardsOk of
  339:               true ->
  340:                   Ges = [guard_expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  341:                   lists:foldr(fun guard_test/2, [Ok], Ges);
  342:               false ->
  343:                   [Ok]
  344:           end,
  345:     Fun1 = make_function(guard_tests, Gts),
  346:     Bts = lists:foldr(fun body_test/2, [Ok], Es),
  347:     Fun2 = make_function(body_tests, Bts),
  348:     Bbts = lists:foldr(fun internal_bif/2, [Ok], Es),
  349:     Fun3 = make_function(bif_tests, Bbts),
  350:     Id = {function,1,id,1,[{clause,1,[{var,1,'I'}],[],[{var,1,'I'}]}]},
  351:     Module0 = make_module(op_tests, [Fun1,Fun2,Fun3,Id]),
  352:     Module = erl_parse:new_anno(Module0),
  353:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> io:put_chars([erl_pp:form(F),"\n"]) end, Module),
  354: 
  355:     %% Compile, load, and run the generated module. Test both with and
  356:     %% without compiler optimizations to ensure that we test both the
  357:     %% implementation of the BIFs and the BEAM instructions.
  358:     do_run_test_module(Module, []),
  359:     do_run_test_module(Module, [no_copt,no_ssa_opt,no_postopt]).
  360: 
  361: do_run_test_module(Module, Opts) ->
  362:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:forms(Module, [time|Opts]),
  363:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  364:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  365: 
  366:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code1),
  367: 
  368:     run_function(Mod, guard_tests),
  369:     run_function(Mod, body_tests),
  370:     run_function(Mod, bif_tests),
  371: 
  372:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  373:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  374: 
  375:     ok.
  376: 
  377: expr({Op,X}) ->
  378:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]}},
  379:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X}]),
  380:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  381: expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  382:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]},Y},
  383:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X,Y}]),
  384:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  385: 
  386: guard_expr({Op,X}) ->
  387:     E = {op,1,Op,X},
  388:     Res = eval([E]),
  389:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  390: guard_expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  391:     E = {op,1,Op,X,Y},
  392:     Res = eval([E]),
  393:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  394: 
  395: run_function(Mod, Name) ->
  396:     case catch Mod:Name() of
  397:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
  398:             io:format("~p", [get(last)]),
  399:             ct:fail({'EXIT',Reason});
  400:         _Other ->
  401:             ok
  402:     end.
  403: 
  404: guard_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  405:     True = unvalue(true),
  406:     [save_term(Expr),
  407:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  408:       {'if',1,[{clause,1,[],[[E]],[True]},
  409:                {clause,1,[],[[True]],[unvalue(false)]}]}}|Tail].
  410: 
  411: body_test({E,Expr,{'EXIT',_}}, Tail) ->
  412:     [save_term(Expr),
  413:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  414:       {'catch',1,E}}|Tail];
  415: body_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  416:     [save_term(Expr),
  417:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),E}|Tail].
  418: 
  419: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  420:     internal_bif(Op, [X], Expr, Res, Tail);
  421: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X,Y},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  422:     internal_bif(Op, [X,Y], Expr, Res, Tail).
  423: 
  424: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, {'EXIT',_}, Tail) ->
  425:     [save_term(Expr),
  426:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  427:       {'catch',1,{call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}}|Tail];
  428: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, Res, Tail) ->
  429:     [save_term(Expr),
  430:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  431:       {call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}|Tail].
  432: 
  433: save_term(Term) ->
  434:     {call,1,
  435:      {atom,1,put},
  436:      [{atom,1,last},unvalue(Term)]}.
  437: 
  438: make_module(Name, Funcs) ->
  439:     [{attribute,1,module,Name},
  440:      {attribute,0,compile,export_all} |
  441:      Funcs ++ [{eof,0}]].
  442: 
  443: make_function(Name, Body) ->
  444:     {function,1,Name,0,[{clause,1,[],[],Body}]}.
  445: 
  446: eval(E0) ->
  447:     E = erl_parse:new_anno(E0),
  448:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(E, []) of
  449:         {'EXIT',Reason} -> {'EXIT',Reason};
  450:         {value,Val,_Bs} -> Val
  451:     end.
  452: 
  453: unsafe_fusing(_Config) ->
  454:     0 = usec_to_seconds(id(1)),
  455:     234_567 = usec_to_seconds(id(1_234_567_890*1_000)),
  456:     ok.
  457: 
  458: usec_to_seconds(Usec) when is_integer(Usec) ->
  459:     %% The introduction of typed operands caused the loader
  460:     %% to incorrectly fuse the following instrutions because
  461:     %% the result register ({x,0}) from the 'div' instruction
  462:     %% seemed to be distinct from both operands of the 'rem'
  463:     %% instruction:
  464:     %%
  465:     %% {gc_bif,'div',
  466:     %%         {f,0},
  467:     %%         1,
  468:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  469:     %%         {x,0}}.
  470:     %% {gc_bif,'rem',
  471:     %%         {f,0},
  472:     %%         1,
  473:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  474:     %%         {x,0}}.
  475:     Sec = Usec div 1000000,
  476:     Sec rem 1000000.
  477: 
  478: range_tests(_Config) ->
  479:     %% Define the limits for smalls on a 64-bit system.
  480:     {MinSmall, MaxSmall} = {-1 bsl 59, (1 bsl 59) - 1},
  481:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  482:         8 ->
  483:             %% Assertions.
  484:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall-1),
  485:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall),
  486:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall),
  487:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall+1);
  488:         4 ->
  489:             ok
  490:     end,
  491: 
  492:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  493:     lesser = range(MinSmall),
  494:     lesser = range(0),
  495:     lesser = range(-1),
  496:     lesser = range(0.9999),
  497: 
  498:     inside = range_any(1),
  499:     inside = range_any(2),
  500:     inside = range_any(2.5),
  501:     inside = range_any(math:pi()),
  502:     inside = range_any(5),
  503:     inside = range_any(9),
  504:     inside = range_any(10),
  505: 
  506:     greater = range(10.0001),
  507:     greater = range(11),
  508:     greater = range(MaxSmall),
  509:     greater = range(1 bsl 64),
  510:     greater = range(atom),
  511:     greater = range(self()),
  512:     greater = range(make_ref()),
  513:     greater = range({a,b}),
  514:     greater = range([a,b]),
  515:     greater = range([]),
  516:     greater = range(<<1,2,3>>),
  517:     greater = range(fun() -> ok end),
  518:     greater = range(fun ?MODULE:range_tests/1),
  519: 
  520:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  521:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  522:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  523:     lesser = range_barely_small(MinSmall - 1),
  524: 
  525:     inside = range_barely_small(MinSmall),
  526:     inside = range_barely_small(-1 bsl 58),
  527:     inside = range_barely_small(0),
  528:     inside = range_barely_small(17.75),
  529:     inside = range_barely_small(1 bsl 58),
  530:     inside = range_barely_small(MaxSmall),
  531: 
  532:     greater = range_barely_small(MaxSmall + 1),
  533:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  534:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  535:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  536: 
  537:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  538:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  539:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  540: 
  541:     inside = range_big(MinSmall),
  542:     inside = range_big(-1 bsl 58),
  543:     inside = range_big(0),
  544:     inside = range_big(17.75),
  545:     inside = range_big(1 bsl 58),
  546:     inside = range_big(MaxSmall),
  547: 
  548:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  549:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  550:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  551: 
  552:     inside = int_range_1(id(-100_000)),
  553:     inside = int_range_1(id(-10)),
  554:     inside = int_range_1(id(100)),
  555:     inside = int_range_1(id(100_000)),
  556: 
  557:     outside = int_range_1(id(atom)),
  558:     outside = int_range_1(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  559:     outside = int_range_1(id(-100_001)),
  560:     outside = int_range_1(id(100_001)),
  561:     outside = int_range_1(id(1 bsl 60)),
  562: 
  563:     inside = int_range_2(id(1)),
  564:     inside = int_range_2(id(42)),
  565:     inside = int_range_2(id(16#f000_0000)),
  566: 
  567:     outside = int_range_2(id([a,list])),
  568:     outside = int_range_2(id(0)),
  569:     outside = int_range_1(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  570:     outside = int_range_1(id(1 bsl 60)),
  571: 
  572:     inside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 28)),
  573:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 28) + 1)),
  574:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 33) + 555)),
  575:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 58) - 1)),
  576:     inside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 58)),
  577: 
  578:     outside = int_range_3(id({a,tuple})),
  579:     outside = int_range_3(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  580:     outside = int_range_3(id(-1000)),
  581:     outside = int_range_3(id(100)),
  582:     outside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 58) + 1)),
  583:     outside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 60)),
  584: 
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: range(X) ->
  588:     Res = range_any(X),
  589:     if
  590:         is_integer(X) ->
  591:             Res = range_any(float(X)),
  592:             Res = range_number(X),
  593:             Res = range_number(float(X)),
  594:             Res = range_int(X),
  595:             if
  596:                 X =:= X band 16#ffff ->
  597:                     Res = range_small_int(X);
  598:                 true ->
  599:                     Res
  600:             end;
  601:         is_number(X) ->
  602:             Res = range_number(X);
  603:         true ->
  604:             Res = range_big(X),
  605:             Res = range_barely_small(X)
  606:     end.
  607: 
  608: range_any(X0) ->
  609:     X = id(X0),
  610:     case range_any_1(X) of
  611:         inside ->
  612:             inside = range_any_2(X);
  613:         Other ->
  614:             outside = range_any_2(X),
  615:             Other
  616:     end.
  617: 
  618: %% The guard tests have different failure labels.
  619: range_any_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  620:     inside;
  621: range_any_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  622:     lesser;
  623: range_any_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  624:     greater.
  625: 
  626: %% The guard tests have the same failure label.
  627: range_any_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  628:     inside;
  629: range_any_2(_) ->
  630:     outside.
  631: 
  632: range_number(X) when is_number(X) ->
  633:     case range_number_1(X) of
  634:         inside ->
  635:             inside = range_number_2(X);
  636:         Other ->
  637:             outside = range_number_2(X),
  638:             Other
  639:     end.
  640: 
  641: range_number_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  642:     inside;
  643: range_number_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  644:     lesser;
  645: range_number_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  646:     greater.
  647: 
  648: range_number_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  649:     inside;
  650: range_number_2(_) ->
  651:     outside.
  652: 
  653: range_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  654:     case range_int_1(X) of
  655:         inside ->
  656:             inside = range_int_2(X);
  657:         Other ->
  658:             outside = range_int_2(X),
  659:             Other
  660:     end.
  661: 
  662: range_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  663:     inside;
  664: range_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  665:     lesser;
  666: range_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  667:     greater.
  668: 
  669: range_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  670:     inside;
  671: range_int_2(_) ->
  672:     outside.
  673: 
  674: range_small_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  675:     case range_small_int_1(X) of
  676:         inside ->
  677:             inside = range_small_int_2(X);
  678:         Other ->
  679:             outside = range_small_int_2(X),
  680:             Other
  681:     end.
  682: 
  683: range_small_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  684:     inside;
  685: range_small_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  686:     lesser;
  687: range_small_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  688:     greater.
  689: 
  690: range_small_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  691:     inside;
  692: range_small_int_2(_) ->
  693:     outside.
  694: 
  695: range_barely_small(X) ->
  696:     case range_barely_small_1(X) of
  697:         inside ->
  698:             inside = range_barely_small_2(X);
  699:         Other ->
  700:             outside = range_barely_small_2(X),
  701:             Other
  702:     end.
  703: 
  704: range_barely_small_1(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  705:     inside;
  706: range_barely_small_1(X) when X < -1 bsl 59 ->
  707:     lesser;
  708: range_barely_small_1(X) when X > (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  709:     greater.
  710: 
  711: range_barely_small_2(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  712:     inside;
  713: range_barely_small_2(_) ->
  714:     outside.
  715: 
  716: range_big(X) ->
  717:     case range_big_1(X) of
  718:         inside ->
  719:             inside = range_big_2(X);
  720:         Other ->
  721:             outside = range_big_2(X),
  722:             Other
  723:     end.
  724: 
  725: range_big_1(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  726:     inside;
  727: range_big_1(X) when X < (-1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  728:     lesser;
  729: range_big_1(X) when X > 1 bsl 59 ->
  730:     greater.
  731: 
  732: range_big_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  733:     inside;
  734: range_big_2(_) ->
  735:     outside.
  736: 
  737: int_range_1(X) when is_integer(X), -100_000 =< X, X =< 100_000 ->
  738:     inside;
  739: int_range_1(_) ->
  740:     outside.
  741: 
  742: int_range_2(X) when is_integer(X), 1 =< X, X =< 16#f000_0000 ->
  743:     inside;
  744: int_range_2(_) ->
  745:     outside.
  746: 
  747: int_range_3(X) when is_integer(X), 1 bsl 28 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 58 ->
  748:     inside;
  749: int_range_3(_) ->
  750:     outside.
  751: 
  752: combined_relops(_Config) ->
  753:     other = test_tok_char(-1 bsl 64),
  754:     other = test_tok_char($A - 1),
  755: 
  756:     var = test_tok_char($A),
  757:     var = test_tok_char($B),
  758:     var = test_tok_char($P),
  759:     var = test_tok_char($Y),
  760:     var = test_tok_char($Z),
  761: 
  762:     other = test_tok_char($Z + 1),
  763: 
  764:     var = tok_char($_),
  765:     other = tok_char(float($_)),
  766: 
  767:     other = test_tok_char(1 bsl 64),
  768: 
  769:     other = test_tok_char(atom),
  770:     other = test_tok_char(self()),
  771: 
  772:     %%
  773:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-200),
  774:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-101),
  775: 
  776:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-100),
  777:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-50),
  778:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-10),
  779: 
  780:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-9),
  781:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-6),
  782: 
  783:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-5),
  784: 
  785:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-4),
  786:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(0),
  787:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(42),
  788: 
  789:     %%
  790:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1 bsl 59),
  791: 
  792:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  793:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1 bsl 58),
  794:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1000),
  795:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(1 bsl 58),
  796:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 10),
  797: 
  798:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 9),
  799: 
  800:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 5),
  801: 
  802:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 4),
  803:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  804: 
  805:     %%
  806:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1 bsl 59),
  807: 
  808:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  809:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1 bsl 58),
  810:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1000),
  811:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(1 bsl 58),
  812: 
  813:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 20),
  814:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 15),
  815:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 10),
  816: 
  817:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 9),
  818: 
  819:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 5),
  820: 
  821:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 4),
  822:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  823: 
  824:     %%
  825:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(-1 bsl 59),
  826: 
  827:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  828:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 3),
  829:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 5),
  830: 
  831:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 6),
  832:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 9),
  833: 
  834:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 10),
  835: 
  836:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 11),
  837: 
  838:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(0),
  839:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(1000),
  840: 
  841:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  842: 
  843:     %% Test a sequence that can't occur in optimized code:
  844:     %%   is_ge Fail Src 10
  845:     %%   is_ge Fail Src 5
  846:     Module = {?FUNCTION_NAME,[{test,1}],[],
  847:               [{function, test, 1, 2,
  848:                 [{label,1},
  849:                  {line,[{location,"t.erl",4}]},
  850:                  {func_info,{atom,?FUNCTION_NAME},{atom,test},1},
  851:                  {label,2},
  852:                  {test,is_ge,{f,4},
  853:                   [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,{0,1000}}},
  854:                    {integer,10}]},
  855:                  {test,is_ge,
  856:                   {f,3},
  857:                   [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,{0,1000}}},
  858:                    {integer,5}]},
  859:                  {label,3},
  860:                  {move,{atom,a},{x,0}},
  861:                  return,
  862:                  {label,4},
  863:                  {move,{atom,b},{x,0}},
  864:                  return]}],
  865:               5},
  866: 
  867:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:forms(Module, [from_asm,time,report]),
  868:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code),
  869: 
  870:     b = Mod:test(0),
  871:     b = Mod:test(5),
  872:     b = Mod:test(9),
  873: 
  874:     a = Mod:test(10),
  875:     a = Mod:test(11),
  876:     a = Mod:test(1000),
  877: 
  878:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  879:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  880: 
  881:     LargeMap = #{K => K || K <- lists:seq(1, 64)},
  882:     Ref = make_ref(),
  883:     [{}] = empty_map_or_nil(id({})),
  884:     [{a,b}] = empty_map_or_nil(id({a,b})),
  885:     [#{a := b}] = empty_map_or_nil(id(#{a => b})),
  886:     [LargeMap] = empty_map_or_nil(id(LargeMap)),
  887:     [Ref] = empty_map_or_nil(id(Ref)),
  888:     [[a,b,c]] = empty_map_or_nil(id([a,b,c])),
  889:     [a] = empty_map_or_nil(id(a)),
  890:     [42] = empty_map_or_nil(id(42)),
  891:     [] = empty_map_or_nil(id(#{})),
  892:     [] = empty_map_or_nil(id([])),
  893: 
  894:     ok.
  895: 
  896: test_tok_char(C) ->
  897:     Result = tok_char(C),
  898:     if
  899:         is_integer(C) ->
  900:             Result = tok_char(float(C)),
  901:             Result = tok_char_int(C),
  902:             if
  903:                 C band 16#FFFF =:= C ->
  904:                     Result = tok_char_int_range(C);
  905:                 true ->
  906:                     Result
  907:             end;
  908:         true ->
  909:             Result
  910:     end.
  911: 
  912: %% is_ge + is_lt
  913: tok_char(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  914:     var;
  915: tok_char($_) ->
  916:     var;
  917: tok_char(_) ->
  918:     other.
  919: 
  920: %% is_ge + is_ge
  921: tok_char_int(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  922:     var;
  923: tok_char_int($_) ->
  924:     var;
  925: tok_char_int(_) ->
  926:     other.
  927: 
  928: %% is_ge + is_ge
  929: tok_char_int_range(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  930:     var;
  931: tok_char_int_range($_) ->
  932:     var;
  933: tok_char_int_range(_) ->
  934:     other.
  935: 
  936: %% is_ge + is_ge
  937: ge_ge_int_range_1(X) when -100 =< X, X =< -10 ->
  938:     a;
  939: ge_ge_int_range_1(-5) ->
  940:     a;
  941: ge_ge_int_range_1(_) ->
  942:     b.
  943: 
  944: ge_ge_int_range_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) + 1 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 10 ->
  945:     a;
  946: ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 5) ->
  947:     a;
  948: ge_ge_int_range_2(_) ->
  949:     b.
  950: 
  951: ge_ge_int_range_3(X) when (1 bsl 59) - 20 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 10 ->
  952:     a;
  953: ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 5) ->
  954:     a;
  955: ge_ge_int_range_3(_) ->
  956:     b.
  957: 
  958: ge_ge_int_range_4(X) when (-1 bsl 59) + 1 =< X, X =< (-1 bsl 59) + 5 ->
  959:     a;
  960: ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 10) ->
  961:     a;
  962: ge_ge_int_range_4(_) ->
  963:     b.
  964: 
  965: %% GH-8325. An inverted test with an empty map would fail for
  966: %% non-boxed terms.
  967: empty_map_or_nil(V) when V =:= #{}; V =:= [] ->
  968:     [];
  969: empty_map_or_nil(V) ->
  970:     [V].
  971: 
  972: %% Tests operators where type hints are significant.
  973: typed_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  974:     _ = [compare_integer_pid(1 bsl N) || N <- lists:seq(1, 64)],
  975: 
  976:     {error,<<7:3>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<7:3>>, 0}),
  977:     {error,<<0:8>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:8>>, 0}),
  978:     {error,<<0:9>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:9>>, 0}),
  979:     {text, 42} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:3>>, 42}),
  980: 
  981:     {error,<<7:3>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<7:3>>, 0}),
  982:     {error,<<0:8>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:8>>, 0}),
  983:     {error,<<0:9>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:9>>, 0}),
  984:     {binary, 42} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:3>>, 42}),
  985: 
  986:     negative = classify_value(id(-1 bsl 128)),
  987:     other = classify_value(id(0)),
  988:     other = classify_value(id(42)),
  989:     other = classify_value(id(1 bsl 64)),
  990:     other = classify_value(id(a)),
  991: 
  992:     ok.
  993: 
  994: compare_integer_pid(N) when is_integer(N) ->
  995:     Immed = self(),
  996:     true = is_pid(Immed),
  997:     if
  998:         N >= Immed -> ct:fail("integer compared greater than pid");
  999:         N < Immed -> ok
 1000:     end.
 1001: 
 1002: %% GH-7433. Equality and non-equality tests with a bitstring could fail when it
 1003: %% should succeed and vice versa.
 1004: compare_bitstring({text, Res, _Data}) when is_bitstring(Res), Res =/= <<0:3>> ->
 1005:     {error, Res};
 1006: compare_bitstring({binary, Res, _Data}) when is_bitstring(Res), Res =/= <<0:3>> ->
 1007:     {error, Res};
 1008: compare_bitstring({binary, _Res, Data}) ->
 1009:     {binary, Data};
 1010: compare_bitstring({text, _Res, Data}) ->
 1011:     {text, Data}.
 1012: 
 1013: classify_value(N) when is_integer(N), N < 0 ->
 1014:     negative;
 1015: classify_value(_N) ->
 1016:     other.
 1017: 
 1018: term_equivalence(_Config) ->
 1019:     %% Term equivalence has been tested before in this suite, but we need to
 1020:     %% massage some edge cases that cannot easily be put into the other test
 1021:     %% cases.
 1022:     <<PosZero/float>> = id(<<0:1,0:63>>),
 1023:     <<NegZero/float>> = id(<<1:1,0:63>>),
 1024: 
 1025:     +0.0 = id(PosZero),
 1026:     -0.0 = id(NegZero),
 1027: 
 1028:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(NegZero, PosZero),
 1029:     1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(PosZero, NegZero),
 1030: 
 1031:     -1 = cmp_float(NegZero, PosZero),
 1032:     1 = cmp_float(PosZero, NegZero),
 1033: 
 1034:     Floats = [0.0, -0.0, 4711.0, -4711.0, 12.0, 943.0],
 1035: 
 1036:     [true = (cmp_float(A, B) =:= erts_internal:cmp_term(A, B)) ||
 1037:      A <- Floats, B <- Floats],
 1038: 
 1039:     ok.
 1040: 
 1041: cmp_float(A0, B0) ->
 1042:     A = float_comparable(A0),
 1043:     B = float_comparable(B0),
 1044:     if
 1045:         A < B -> -1;
 1046:         A > B -> +1;
 1047:         A =:= B -> 0
 1048:     end.
 1049: 
 1050: %% Converts a float to a number which, when compared with other such converted
 1051: %% floats, is ordered the same as '<' on the original inputs aside from the
 1052: %% fact that -0.0 < +0.0 as required by the term equivalence order.
 1053: %%
 1054: %% This has been proven correct with the SMT-LIB model below:
 1055: %%
 1056: %% (define-const SignBit_bv (_ BitVec 64) #x8000000000000000)
 1057: %% 
 1058: %% ; Two finite floats X and Y of unknown value
 1059: %% (declare-const X (_ FloatingPoint 11 53))
 1060: %% (declare-const Y (_ FloatingPoint 11 53))
 1061: %% (assert (= false (fp.isInfinite X) (fp.isInfinite Y)
 1062: %%            (fp.isNaN X) (fp.isNaN Y)))
 1063: %% 
 1064: %% ; ... the bit representations of the aforementioned floats. The Z3 floating-
 1065: %% ; point extension lacks a way to directly bit-cast a vector to a float, so
 1066: %% ; we rely on equivalence here.
 1067: %% (declare-const X_bv (_ BitVec 64))
 1068: %% (declare-const Y_bv (_ BitVec 64))
 1069: %% (assert (= ((_ to_fp 11 53) X_bv) X))
 1070: %% (assert (= ((_ to_fp 11 53) Y_bv) Y))
 1071: %% 
 1072: %% ; The bit hack we're going to test
 1073: %% (define-fun float_sortable ((value (_ BitVec 64))) (_ BitVec 64)
 1074: %% (ite (distinct (bvand value SignBit_bv) SignBit_bv)
 1075: %%  (bvxor value SignBit_bv)
 1076: %%  (bvnot value)))
 1077: %% 
 1078: %% (define-fun float_bv_lt ((LHS (_ BitVec 64))
 1079: %%                          (RHS (_ BitVec 64))) Bool
 1080: %%  (bvult (float_sortable LHS) (float_sortable RHS)))
 1081: %% 
 1082: %% (push 1)
 1083: %%   ; When either of X or Y are non-zero, (X < Y) = (bvX < bvY)
 1084: %%   (assert (not (and (fp.isZero X) (fp.isZero Y))))
 1085: %%   (assert (distinct (fp.lt X Y) (float_bv_lt X_bv Y_bv)))
 1086: %%   (check-sat) ; unsat, proving by negation that the above always holds
 1087: %% (pop 1)
 1088: %% 
 1089: %% (push 1)
 1090: %%   ; Negative zero should sort lower than positive zero
 1091: %%   (assert (and (fp.isNegative X) (fp.isPositive Y)
 1092: %%                (fp.isZero X) (fp.isZero Y)))
 1093: %%   (assert (not (float_bv_lt X_bv Y_bv)))
 1094: %%   (check-sat) ; unsat
 1095: %% (pop 1)
 1096: float_comparable(V0) ->
 1097:     Sign = 16#8000000000000000,
 1098:     Mask = 16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF,
 1099:     <<V_bv:64/unsigned>> = <<V0/float>>,
 1100:     case V_bv band Sign of
 1101:         0 -> (V_bv bxor Sign) band Mask;
 1102:         Sign -> (bnot V_bv) band Mask
 1103:     end.
 1104: 
 1105: %%%
 1106: %%% Utilities.
 1107: %%%
 1108: 
 1109: unvalue(V) ->
 1110:     Abstr = erl_parse:abstract(V),
 1111:     erl_parse:anno_to_term(Abstr).
 1112: 
 1113: value({nil,_}) -> [];
 1114: value({integer,_,X}) -> X;
 1115: value({string,_,X}) -> X;
 1116: value({float,_,X})   -> X;
 1117: value({atom,_,X})    -> X;
 1118: value({tuple,_,Es}) ->
 1119:     list_to_tuple(lists:map(fun(X) -> value(X) end, Es));
 1120: value({cons,_,H,T}) ->
 1121:     [value(H) | value(T)];
 1122: value(Other) ->
 1123:     {value,Value,_} = erl_eval:expr(Other, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
 1124:     Value.
 1125: 
 1126: repeat(_, 0) -> ok;
 1127: repeat(Fun, N) ->
 1128:     Fun(),
 1129:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 1130: 
 1131: id(I) -> I.
